intro: Androsyne gracilis, commonly known as the slender androsyne, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its slender stems and small, daisy-like flowers make it an attractive yet often overlooked species. Androsyne gracilis plays a minor role in local ecosystems, primarily as a food source for specific insect pollinators.
